alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 09 at 3:23AM EDT until May 09 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN LAUREL, NORTHEASTERN PULASKI AND SOUTHERN ROCKCASTLE COUNTIES... At 323 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... London, Mount Vernon, Luner, Pongo, Sand Hill, Wellhope, Hansford, Sand Springs, Bloss, Pine Hill, Burr, Wabp, Camp Wildcat, Hazel Patch, Level Green, Gauley, Spiro, Bromo, Maretburg and Wood Creek Lake. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sinking Branch, Skegg Creek, Warren Branch, Sugarcamp Branch, Lick Branch, Town Branch, Sampson Branch, Barney Branch, Wood Creek, Hawk Creek, Parker Branch, South Fork Rockcastle River, Patton Branch, Jason Branch, Jake Branch, White Oak Creek, Dorman Creek, Indian Creek, Little Raccoon Creek, Rash Branch, Bee Lick Creek, Buck Creek, Brushy Creek, Briary Creek and Long Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
